description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Higher quality programmes through results-based management and improved accountability of results.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - public finance management for Health

Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for mostdisadvantaged children.
No. of models for promoting access of vulnerable communities to social protection piloted and studied for policy upscaling.

target.value: 2017:CSSP pilots tested and studied for upscaling in at least three states

actual.value: 2014:In one state – Madhya Pradesh – the pilot on unconditional cash transfer study was completed and report with policy recommendations was finalised and disseminated widely. In Uttar Pradesh, the red alert (missed out basic services across seven departments) community monitoring system was implemented.

title.narrative: Extent to which national and state governments are knowledgeable and demonstrate commitment towards applying the child sensitive social protection guidance

actual.value: 2014:Government of West Bengal implemented a conditional cash transfer program for girls through a child-sensitive social protection lens. Mapping of social protection programmes was undertaken by five states to build evidence about the child-sensitivity of schemes and provide a basis for engagement with
